definition: to knock on a door
to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
lit. a brick as a door knocker (idiom); fig. a temporary expedient/to use sb as a stepping stone to fortune
He who never wrongs others does not fear the knock in the night./Rest with a clear conscience.
pinyin: bu4 zuo4 kui1 xin1 shi4 , bu4 pa4 gui3 qiao1 men2
containing_words.word: 不做虧心事，不怕鬼敲門

definition: He who never wrongs others does not fear the knock in the night./Rest with a clear conscience.
pinyin: ping2 sheng1 bu4 zuo4 kui1 xin1 shi4 , ban4 ye4 qiao1 men2 xin1 bu4 jing1
containing_words.word: 平生不做虧心事，半夜敲門心不驚

sentences.english: The guy warned me that you have to knock on the door first to scatter them away.
sentences.chinese: 店員警告我說開門前最好先敲敲門，以便把它們嚇跑。

sentences.english: Next, there was a knock on the door of the village shoe-maker.
sentences.chinese: 然後，村子的鞋匠聽到了敲門聲。

sentences.english: It sounds like sb.'s knocking on the door.
Tom was sitting near the fire when he heared a knock located on the door.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆正坐在火爐邊，這時他聽到一陣敲門聲。

sentences.english: Open not your door when the devil knock.
sentences.chinese: 魔鬼敲門慎莫開，開門必有災禍來。

sentences.english: Sometimes the men's wives came and beat on the door.
sentences.chinese: 有時侯這些人的妻子會來敲門。

sentences.english: He knocked firmly on the door.
We hesitated at the door for a moment, and were about to knock.
sentences.chinese: 我們在門口踟躇了一下，準備敲門。

sentences.english: The masseuse was let in by a housekeeper, who then knocked on the door of Ledger's bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 按摩師由一位女管家領着，來到萊傑臥室的門外敲門。

sentences.english: Nowadays, educational qualifications and professional competence credentials are the stepping-stone(passport) to get a good job .
sentences.chinese: 現如今學歷和專業技能證書是找到好工作的敲門磚。

sentences.english: The knocking was loud and long, but it failed to rouse the drowsy inmates.
sentences.chinese: 敲門的聲音又響又長，但是敲不醒裏面睡熟了的人們。

sentences.english: The small white rabbit holding carrot, ran to the monkey house and knocked on the door, no one answered.
sentences.chinese: 小白兔抱着蘿蔔，跑到小猴家，敲敲門，沒人答應。

sentences.english: As the brother and sister were about to rise from the table, there came a knock at the door.
sentences.chinese: 正在兄妹倆要離開桌子時，有人敲門。

sentences.english: Addresses play a rule of stepping stone in social communications.
sentences.chinese: 社會交往中，稱謂詞扮演着敲門磚的作用。

sentences.english: Pinkerton and the Consul knock at the door and enter.
sentences.chinese: 平克頓和領事敲門進來。

definition: to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
door of a room
outside the door
to enter a door/to go in/to learn the basics of a subject/to join one's husband's household upon marriage
to hear
to push open (a gate etc)/to push away/to reject/to decline
to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
to go upstairs
to close (a door)/to turn off (light, electrical equipment etc)
to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
first tone in Mandarin (high, level tone)
to open one's mouth/to start to talk
to hear
outside/out
to interrupt/to break off/to break (a bone)
to leave/to exit
